content.description: Low crux that can be climbed around to the left.  Cruiser jugs up high.  Steep for 5.8.
content.location: Third route from the left side of the cliff.

climbs.name: Road Rage
climbs.fa: Tom Ogden and Helen Shull July 8th 2007

content.description: Road Rage starts on the Cooler (Cooler Crack) and then cuts right on the seam to crack system that diagonals up and right, joining Nighthawk at the 5th bolt and continues to the top of Nighthawk
content.protection: Gear and draws for the final bolted section

content.description:
Start at the green bolt 10 feet right of Cooler and continue for two more bolts up to the mini-roof where you can place a .75-1" cam. Climb directly over the roof and 10 feet to another bolt. from here follow any other route to the top.

This route intersects Road Rage, which traverses under the roof from cooler to the far end on gear.

I think the name comes from the one particularly sharp hold under the roof.

Fun little route!!
content.protection: 5-8 bolts depending on where you go after the roof. Optional .75-1" cam
content.location: To the right of Cooler and left of Nighthawk.

content.description: One of the harder routes on the pinch me wall, crux is the first half of the route, sustained 5.10 climbing to some side pulls and some smearing, eases up at the top. Might be a tad harder than its neighbor Nighthawk.
content.location: first route you come to on the Pinch Me Wall

climbs.name: Pinch Me I Must Be Dreaming

content.description: One-move wonder crux between 3rd and 4th bolts.  Helps to be a little taller.  Rest of route is cruiser 5.7/5.8 climbing.  One of the longer offerings at Land Of The Lost.  Watch for rope drag if lowering, anchors are set a little far back.
content.location: Middle/right of the wall.  Starts just left of a small right-facing dihedral.

content.description: Low crux (bolts 3-4?) on slightly circuitous climbing.  Thin down low, gets easier the higher you go.  One of the more difficult routes at the Pinch Me Wall.
content.location: Second bolted route from the right side of the cliff.

content.description: Starts the same as Pinch Me, but cuts right after the small ledge. Make a semi-airy clip, followed by some interesting moves involving a short crack and finally a romp to the anchors.
content.location: same start as Pinch Me I Must Be Dreaming, left of the big cooler/cave

content.description: Surprisingly steep for 5.7, and another jug haul.  Pull a small bulge about halfway up.  Good route for aspiring lead climbers.
content.location: First route on the left side of the cliff.

content.description: Another great 5.7, it is similar to Emerald Forest, but somewhat more diverse and slightly easier.
content.protection: 5 bolts to 2 bolt anchors with chains.
content.location: Look for a bush halfway up the wall, the route climbs directly under a branch on the right side.

climbs.name: Five Fun
climbs.fa: Paul Humphrey, Rick and Helen Shull

content.description: Gear route that starts left or Easily Amused and goes up and right following a gash, finishing at a tree. It actually has less gear than leading most of the sport routes 5.6-5.8 on the Pinch Me wall on gear, but is only 5.5 at the crux. Walk off or traverse over to one of the other anchors to rap off.
content.location: Starts left of Easily Amused, finishes above Suprisingly Delightful.

content.description: Fun route with great jugs the whole way!
content.location: Left of Pinch Me I'm Dreaming.

content.description: Moderate jug haul, and a great first lead.  Guidebook suggests gear, but it protects fine without it.
content.location: Second bolted route from the left side of the cliff.

content.description:
Left of Mommy's Little Monster, this sinister overhang has laid in wait. Climb two bolts of fun face up to a small roof. Find the hidden jugs and attack the little beast straight on.

The third and fourth bolts are overhanging, so don't fear if Daddy's Little Devil spits you off, the falls are clean and 90% air. In fact, what better way to enjoy that mountain air than at 9.8 m/s^2? Go ahead, let go... I dare you...

After you're done horsing around, finish up to the chains, and rig a top rope for Daddy's Little Deviate, the larger and harder right hand side of the roof. Good Luck!
content.protection: Five Bolts, Chains with lower off biners
content.location: Farthest route left on Pinch Me Wall.

content.description: Another rare Humboldt gear route, abet short. Steep dihedral with good stemming and jams. At the top of the crack move left towards a bolt and follow any bolted line to the top.
content.location: The obvious crack above where you stored your beers.

climbs.name: Casually Crushable
climbs.fa: Solo FA: Unknown.  Bolted: Evan W. FLA: Amand M

content.description:
Newly bolted line following great jugs through the cave.

The route climbs straight up following the cleaner rock, no need to traverse over any of the moss. Once at the cave, your way up while clipping bolts and grabbing jugs on your left. Finish at Mommy’s Little Monster anchor.

Where’s the next bolt...it’s right above the last one. No need to do any traversing into the mossy stuff.
content.location: climbs just left of a bush between MLM and EA. Technically the first bolt is at the start of Five Fun. The bolts might be painted too camouflaged.
